title: How to Create an Airlock for Making Wine or Beer

steps.title: Clean out a clear plastic bottle.
steps.content: Clean out a clear plastic bottle. Prescription pill bottles with the label removed work well.

steps.title: Drill an 1⁄8 inch (0.3 cm) hole in the lid and a hole the size of an average ballpoint pen in the bottom of the bottle.
steps.content: Drill an 1 ⁄ 8 inch (0.3 cm) hole in the lid and a hole the size of an average ballpoint pen in the bottom of the bottle. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Take the guts out of a ballpoint pen so that you have an open tube remaining.
steps.content: Take the guts out of a ballpoint pen so that you have an open tube remaining. Insert the pen in the bottom hole of the pill bottle and push it in all but 1 ⁄ 2 inch (1.3 cm) from the top. Mix fast-curing two-part epoxy and seal the pen to the bottle. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Clean out a rifle cartridge (30/30, 7.62, or anything with a diameter greater than that of the pen).
steps.content: Clean out a rifle cartridge (30/30, 7.62, or anything with a diameter greater than that of the pen). Place it over the end of the pen inside of the pill bottle.

steps.title: Drill a hole in a cork slightly smaller than the diameter of the pen.
steps.content: Drill a hole in a cork slightly smaller than the diameter of the pen. Place the end of the pen all the way through the cork.

steps.title: Fill the pill bottle with water up to 1⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) below the top of the pen inside.
steps.content: Fill the pill bottle with water up to 1 ⁄ 4 inch (0.6 cm) below the top of the pen inside. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Insert the cork end into the bottle in which you are fermenting your wine, beer, or moonshine mash.
steps.content: Insert the cork end into the bottle in which you are fermenting your wine, beer, or moonshine mash.
